definition: qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: The taste is healthy, the vitality is abundant, then the muscle is plentiful, the body is strong.

sentences.english: The disharmony of qi and blood may cause various diseases.

sentences.english: Qi and blood in the body are the material basis for the physiological activities of the zang-fu and meridians.

sentences.english: Qi and blood in the meridians circulate in cycles.
sentences.chinese: 经脉中的气血运行是循环贯注的，如环无端。

sentences.english: Otherwise, the circulation of qi and blood is disorder, and some diseases will emerge.

sentences.english: The flow of Qi and blood in the human body is associated with the changes of weather.

sentences.english: Restrain circulation, get rid of toxin and improve complexion.

definition: five viscera of TCM, namely: heart 心[xin1], liver 肝[gan1], spleen 脾[pi2], lungs 肺[fei4] and kidneys 腎|肾[shen4]
